data.title: Class in the original Downtown
data.text: This is a clever restaurant in downtown Lawton.  The food is extremely pretty and really delicious.  It makes you want to take your time and enjoy.  This would be a great "special" night out restaurant.  They have a upper level that seems good for groups.  The BAKERY that share's space and provides goods for the restaurant knows how to make bread. Yummy!  I would not suggest it for small children but it is a very cozy couples place.  I will upload a picture when I get back from this trip.

data.title: Loved the live music and wonderful hospitality
data.text: Great place for dinner. I tried fried green beans for the first time. It was a delicious experience. The avocado dip was sldo nice. The restaurant had only one vegetarian option (eggplant), but it was pretty good.  I personally didn't enjoy the pasta, but the eggplant was tasty. The restaurant had a great team of people, who were all super nice. There was also live music, which was really pleasant acoustic guitar. Great way to spend time with friends.

data.title: Excellent Find!
data.text: We happened upon this rare find after stopping by the mall for lunch and we were pleasantly surprised.  We decided to go back again for dinner the following night and it transforms into a whole other place with a live band.  The food was spectacular and the prices were incredible for the amount of food!

data.title: Lawton's jewel! It's a must!
data.text:
Can't say enough good things about this place. Incredible welcoming staff, elaborate and deliciously prepared food, a full bar, cozy and elegant atmosphere... Not only do I plan to return; I plan to market this venue to everyone who goes to Lawton. 
I had the house salad with vinaigrette, the salmon and the carrot cake... Wow and can't forget the yeast roll! Amazing. 
For a really unique experience make sure you seat upstairs with the true stars... Kimmie and Jonathan!

data.title: Quick, quiet healthy lunch
data.text: We've eaten at the Silver Spoon twice in the past month.  On two separate trips to Lawton we've had lunch there.  We're usually a little later than noon...mid afternoon to be exact.  Food was excellent, staff is courteous and efficient, and the atmosphere was quiet and peaceful.  Very nice!

data.title: Great lunch place
data.text: The Silver Spoon is open for lunch and dinner; but I have only had lunch there when I had business down town. The food is excellent, offering sandwiches and soups and smaller lunch portions if wanted. It's a little pricey, but the food and service is a notch above most places in Lawton; so well worth the extra cost.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Had a farewell lunch with a friend who has never been there before. She was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed every bite. I think she may have went back for dinner.

data.title: Great Service
data.text: I love love love the atmosphere.  Great service with smiles, everything was hot and they followed up glasses always full.  The tables are the neatest antique style and they have recently updated their chairs which is a nice eclectic look.  I ordered a club sandwich which was huge and the spicy dressing was perfect!

data.title: Something different in Lawton
data.text: I stopped here because they had a different menu than most places in town. Unfortunately they do not have a gluten free menu, and most of their options had gluten. I ordered a salad with shrimp. It was unimpressive, but fine. It is well suited for one with no allergies.

data.title: Local downtown
data.text: Home made salad dressing, great hamburgers, chicken fried filet mignon. Nice cozy atmosphere. Good for business or pleasure

data.title: Great place to eat in Lawton
data.text:
The silver spoon is one of the first places I ate when I moved to Lawton with my better half. I find this place to be an amazing place.

The staff is fast moving, the food does take some time to be prepared, but once it gets to the table, it is amazing. The potato soup is so good, I would eat there every day to enjoy it if I could.

This place seems to be one of the best places I have eaten in Lawton.

data.title: On of the best Restaurants in Lawton
data.text:
Small Menu, but nevertheless a good variety of different dishes, 
prepared fresh and delicious. 
The refrigerator offers a great variety of different beers 
from microbreweries of Oklahoma.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Warm family atmosphere with great staff.  Food was flavorful and delicious!  We came to hang out with our family after my nephew graduated from boot camp.  Was the perfect place to sit and visit.

data.title: Silver Spoon
data.text: I have eaten there several times, if you go you must try the potatoe soup and the chicken salad sandwich, it is the best!!

data.title: Nice family lunch
data.text: We were well accommodated for a large family lunch this Friday. We received excellent service and the food was very tasty.

data.title: HAVING SOME PROBLEMS HERE !!!
data.text: NOON--- never got my food waited 50 minutes had to leave--- I only say a few plates come out--- was too long to wait--- The water was tasty-----

data.title: Good food and nice atmosphere
data.text: Went as a work lunch. A lot of choices of sandwiches and salads. Quaint and home like dinning atmosphere.

data.title: Great food in a comfortable environment
data.text: Went out to eat the day before father's day with some friends. The service was pretty good, but the food was amazing. I had a steak and my wife had the pork chop. The have some interesting beer choices. Food was very good. I recommend this place to eat.

data.title: Did you change your baked potato soup?
data.text: I just paid 7$ for baked potato soup, no cheese or bacon, basically vegetable soup with potato... Not what I wanted at all.

data.title: Fantastic Find
data.text: We travel quite a bit and who would have thought such an excellent chef resided in Lawton, OK.  It was not busy for a Saturday night which was great for us on short notice because we had a large group.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.  It had a great wine list and varied menu.  Our group had steak, tuna, chicken pot pie and egg plant parmesan and fresh guacamole.  Not one person had a complaint!  Don't skip the pecan cake dessert.
